column4: I got a problem! I rebooted into windows (duel boot) just to get something (first time in weeks) and when i rebooted back into Ubuntu, now there is something using 100% of my CPU every 3-4 seconds for about a second! anyone have any idea's please
run 'top' to see what it is.
Something you should run.
Nothing showed? Is there a cd or dvd in your drive?
no no cd's or dvd's
Xorg is going up and down from about 15% - 30% that about it
is there a way to make it update faster
top can only do once a second, afaik.
ok dam what is doing it then, making my computer pause every few seconds even when i'm typing it stops
I don't know.
this only happend after i boot into windows XP
Is there anything in 'dmesg' ?
when i run that it says failed, port 3 disabled
then i get a hole lot of hub 5-4:1.0: connect-debounce failed, port 3 disabled
Any weird usb devices plugged in?
I have a few USB things pluged in yes, mouse,joystick,Palm,sidewinder,and belcon speed pad
none of witch gave me problems before
yeah, it would seem odd that they could slow down the machine.
Did you install updates (new kernel?) before booting windows?
mmmm I'm not sure but i think that i may have did an update last night but i booted intolinux earler today and no problems
I've seemed to have found it, I think it was 3ddesktop I killed it and it sems fine now, maybe something to do with my ATI drivers maybe
thanks for you help good night
Try www.linux-laptop.net
If it's not listed there, google is your friend.
